availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: New York soldier. Erie County, New York, native. Son of Clark Merwin Carr and Delia Ann Torry Carr. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1850. Served in the United States Mounted Rifles as a second lieutenant from July 1, 1850, to March 3, 1855. Served in the 1st United States Cavalry as a first lieutenant and captain from March 3, 1855 to August 3, 1861. Served in the 3rd Illinois Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as colonel from August 16, 1861 to March 7, 1862. Wounded at the Battle of Pea Ridge, Benton County, Arkansas, on March 7, 1862. Promoted to Brigadier General of Volunteers on March 7, 1862. Commanded several divisions in the Union Army including in the VII and XVI Corps.

ab.bibl:
Francis Bernard Heitman, Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from Its Organization, September 29, 1789 to March 2, 1903 Volume 1, Part 2 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1903), 285.
Kerry King Jones, "Eugene Asa Carr (1830-1910)," Encyclopedia of Arkansas, Accessed July 8, 2022,https://encyclopediaofarkansas.net/entries/eugene-asa-carr-14465/.
